summary: A MCM menu for adjusting various player stats.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=4][font=Arial]STAT CONTROL PANEL[/font][/size][/b][font=Arial]
A MCM menu for adjusting various player stats.

ATTENTION PLEASE! This mod was written utilizing SkyUI 4.1 and [u][b]will not[/b][/u] feature any updates, modifications, or support for SkyUI 5+ or any future paid versions of SkyUI or the MCM.

[b][size=4]DESCRIPTION[/size][/b]
Everything this mod does can be achieved through the console, it's largely a nice graphical interface for the sake of convenience.

Stats are controlled through sliders, covering everything from Health/Stamina/Magicka and their regen rates, to resists, to weapon swing speeds.

Perks can be toggled on and off individually or en masse by associated skill. Perk tracking allows you to hold on to perks selected through the vanilla game menu when removing perks en masse. Removing a perk added through the vanilla game menu will refund a perk point.

Save and Load options gives you 3 slots in which to save your current SCP configuration, including perks, and load them up between save/new games or share them between computers. (look in ~/Skyrim/Data/SCP_Saves/)

[b][size=4]REQUIREMENTS[/size][/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?]SkyUI[/url] (as this is a purely MCM-centric mod)
[url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE)[/url] (as a requirement for SkyUI)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49743/?]JContainers[/url]
SCP comes bundled with JContainers version 3.1.1
[font=Arial]
[b][size=4]INSTALLING[/size][/b]
Nexus Mod Manager (recommended): Download with manager, highlight then click activate.
Manual: Download SCP.zip and extract into your Skyrim/Data folder

[u][b]IMPORTANT:[/b][/u]
If upgrading to version 2.0+ from an earlier version, it is recommended to perform a clean save before installing the latest version! This means uninstalling the previous version, loading your save game and waiting for MCM to update the menu listing (so that SCP is no longer listed) and then save your game again before installing the latest version of SCP.

[b][size=4]UNINSTALLING[/size][/b]
Nexus Mod Manager: Highlight and click deactivate.
Manual: Remove the files you extracted from SCP.zip from your Skyrim/Data folder. You did keep track, right?[/font]

[size=4][b]CONFLICTS[/b][/size]
Any mod which alters the vanilla skill perks or perk trees may conflict with the perks portion of this mod (including saving/loading). Mods which just tweak the values on individual perks should be fine, but mods which add, remove or reorganize mods more comprehensively will likely be an issue.

[b][size=4]DISCLAIMER[/size][/b]
Standard boilerplate applies. Use at your own risk, not responsible for spontaneous hardware conflagration, may drag the contents of your Skyrim installation directory to Davey Jones' moldy gym locker. If your erection lasts for more than four hours with irregular menstrual flow please see your doctor immediately.

[b][size=4]CREDITS[/size][/b]
Silvericed for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49743/?]JContainers[/url], bundled with his permission (found in the Permissions section of his mod description)[/font]
author: Sithrazer

files.name: SCP 1.1
files.changelogHtml:
v1.1
- Heal/Stamina/Magicka sliders now have a range of 10 - 1000 (from 100 - 1000)
- Heal Rate/Stamina Rate/Magicka Rate sliders now have a range of 0 - 25 (from 0 - 10)
- Magic Resist now has a range of -100 - 100 (from 0 - 100)
- Crit Chance now has a range of 0 - 2000 (from 0 - 100) and updated highlight text.

files.name: SCP 1.2
files.changelogHtml:
- Added an alert message box on completion of add/remove perks.
- Implemented perk tracking and an option to enable/disable the tracking.
- Detached Carry Weight from Stamina and gave it its own slider.
- Added accounting for racial bonuses to default slider values. Supports custom races as far as it shouldn't break when using a non-vanilla race.
- Added sliders for Frost Resist, Fire Resist, Shock Resist, Poison Resist, Disease Resist, and Unarmed Damage.
- Adjusted some of the highlight texts.
- Implemented some semblance of proper internal version updating (all you should ever notice is a msg in the corner the first time running the game after an update).
